HDG.IM.content: [method, “is”] away from empty “Being” to special characteristics of beings themselves: earth, moon, land, sea, Japanese > Heidegger will not be doubting being [?], such considerations, w/ air of supreme critique, are thoroughly uncritical [is that an argument? factical life dogma?] > we must know what “is” and “to be” means since we let let each being be the being that it is [do we? “w/out thinking,” he adds]

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.IM.linkedContent: [method, “is”] away from empty “Being” to special characteristics of beings themselves: earth, moon, land, sea, Japanese > Heidegger will not be doubting being [?], such considerations, w/ air of supreme critique, are thoroughly uncritical [is that an argument? factical life dogma?] > we must know what “is” and “to be” means since we let let each being be the being that it is [do we? “w/out thinking,” he adds]

HDG.BC.content: knowing grammar contributes nothing to our understanding [what about Einführung?] > no doubt about “is” in “weather is fine”—how do we make “is” questionable? > fullness/variability of beings never comes from “is” or being, comes from beings themselves (weather, street, bad, closed, dark)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: knowing grammar contributes nothing to our understanding [what about Einführung?] > no doubt about “is” in “weather is fine”—how do we make “is” questionable? > fullness/variability of beings never comes from “is” or being, comes from beings themselves (weather, street, bad, closed, dark)

HDG.BC.content: Being lets every being as such originate: Being is the origin ——no doubt about Being, the most reliable [but don’t we know Being by way of experience of beings?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being lets every being as such originate: Being is the origin ——no doubt about Being, the most reliable [but don’t we know Being by way of experience of beings?]

HDG.QB.content: “attempt to cross the line” captivated in form of representation (in ein Vorstellen gebannt) belonging to dominion (Herrschaftsbereich) of oblivion of Being > subject to doubts, like every image > but these doubts (Zweifeln) can’t touch illuminative force of images, their originary/uncircumventable presence (ursprüngliche und unumgehbare Gegenwart)—shows how little experience we have in the saying of thinking (der Sage des Denkens), in essence of such saying
